body_html:
Thanks, @andrewharp .
Yes, I found the "control_flow_ops.cc" in my BUILD file. I think the file I use includse this op.
Is it possible that the error is cause by a wrong tensor definition?

I create the tensor using c++,

static bool tensor_phase_value =  false;

    tensorflow::Tensor tensor_phase(
        tensorflow::DT_BOOL,
        tensorflow::TensorShape({ 1}));
    auto tensor_phase_mapped = tensor_phase.tensor<bool, 1>();
    tensor_phase_mapped(0) = tensor_phase_value;

It should be a bool tensor, in python model , it looks like this:
phase_train_placeholder = tf.placeholder(tf.bool, name='phase_train')

Is there anything improper here?

Thanks

body:
Thanks, @andrewharp .
Yes, I found the "control_flow_ops.cc" in my BUILD file. I think the file I use includse this op.
Is it possible that the error is cause by a wrong tensor definition? 

I create the tensor using c++,

```
static bool tensor_phase_value =  false;

    tensorflow::Tensor tensor_phase(
        tensorflow::DT_BOOL,
        tensorflow::TensorShape({ 1}));
    auto tensor_phase_mapped = tensor_phase.tensor<bool, 1>();
    tensor_phase_mapped(0) = tensor_phase_value;
```

It should be a bool tensor, in python model , it looks like this:
`phase_train_placeholder = tf.placeholder(tf.bool, name='phase_train')`

Is there anything improper here?

Thanks
